comment.author: 42264328@N00
comment._content: Ice Yacht (or Ice Boat) Tyro shows up in a couple of NY Times articles: -17 January 1920 -13 December 1915--mentions that owner is Thomas Henry Grant. -22 January 1918 NY Times mentions a collision between Gull and Tyro in a race at Red Bank, New Jersey. Given the adjacent photo of crowds on the ice is labeled "At Red Bank", it seems likely this is the site of these photos. A recent reference mentions the Tyro, appears to be the same yacht--Fond Memories--January 2002. Remarkably, the correspondent, Robert Clark II, says (no date given) that: My family still has the Tyro and we wait patiently for the ice to set up in the flats each year.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks! We'll add the information in the source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 21800290@N06
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Vintage New Jersey, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 26131438@N08
comment._content: Yeah I was going to guess Red Bank as well - a lot of my research on my hometown a bit farther south of there in the New York Tribune microfilm files at the New York Public Library from 1914-1917 crossed paths with many such photos from Red Bank.
